messageBody:
On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 8:38 AM, Joakim Ohlrogge
<joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:

> Isolation scores pretty high on my list, at the moment I rely on it
> completely. To answer your question about how many tests would break
> if the instance was shared I must confess, I have no idea, I assume
> too many considering that I spend 0 effort restoring state and I
> don't want that extra possibility to consider when tests do break. On
> the other hand, If no fixture was ever setup in the constructor or,
> more commonly, when the field is declared I'd have to admit that
> sharing an instance would probably not be an issue. Tools like PMD
> could find those situations by static analisys and a rule could be
> added to fail those tests in the build...
>
> So there is a way to convert to shared instances that i would be
> comfortable with given some clear benefit of doing so, now what is the
> benefit?

The main advantage I have seen is that I no longer need to use static
fields and boolean guards to maintain read-only (and sometimes,
writable) expensive state across method in invocations.

--
Cédric
